did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, microfiche, CD, and printed materials.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Reprints of articles by Homer Hoyt on real estate and economics; letter to Hoyt from C.M. Upham; microfiche copies of the works of Dr. Hoyt, CD-ROM listing of surveys, appraisals, published articles, and speeches.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Hoyt received his Ph.D. in economics and a law degree from the University of Chicago. He is the author of ONE HUNDRED YEARS OF LAND VALUES IN CHICAGO and THE STRUCTURE AND GROWTH OF RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOODS IN AMERICAN CITIES. Member, International Fraternity of Lambda Alpha, George Washington Chapter.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Reprints of articles by Homer Hoyt on real estate and economics; letter to Hoyt from C.M. Upham; microfiche copies of the works of Dr. Hoyt, CD-ROM listing of surveys, appraisals, published articles, and speeches.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Lambda Alpha International. George Washington Chapter.
Lambda Alpha International. George Washington Chapter

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Homer Hoyt Papers, #2721. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Part of Lambda Alpha Literary Archives.

did.unittitle: Collection consists of two boxes. Online guide unavailable.
